metadata.bijbeltekst: Romans 8:22, Habakkuk 3:17, Job 23:10, Matthew 10:30-31, John 3:16, 1 John 3:1-2, Revelation 5:9-10

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The minister (Subject) enters a 'ghastly arena' of global and psychological chaos (Opponent) to deliver the Gospel (Object) to a frightened generation (Receiver) so they may recover their identity as children of God.

tekstueel_bewijs: the minister of Jesus Christ comes, a lonely knight
We who preach Christ... bring to our world a meeting place
we are commissioned to live our days, holding before our people this judgment and mercy

object.identificatie: The Gospel / Healing / Restoration of Identity
tekstueel_bewijs: the gospel which shall be for the healing of all nations
the means by which lost men are to be found
rescue from the status of spiritually displaced persons
we are commissioned to live our days
people in whose eyes there is written anxiety, fear
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one in need of rescue).

helper.identificatie: The Cross / The Gospel / Christ's Victory
tekstueel_bewijs: the cross as the earth's sovereign symbol
helper.rol_van_god: God is the source of the Helper (the Cross), while the Minister is the active Subject using the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (The Gospel as a tool).

tegenstander.identificatie: Secularism (Darwin/Marx/Freud), Sin, Death, and Global Conflict
tekstueel_bewijs: high priests of the secular spirit
the age-old background of sin, sickness, loneliness, and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but ontological lostness and 'ultimate dreads' that no human ingenuity can solve.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's own action in history (The Christ-event) which provides the 'Object' for the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God / Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The Minister's program depends entirely on the prior success of God's program at Calvary.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God, once and for all, has assessed our value
God has thrown in for us
He knoweth the way that I take
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Ministers today must face a world
We pull the curtains and talk small talk

voorbeelden: Ministers today must face a world
You got to stand your test in judgment
Our generation does not like to mention these age-old dreads
we do not know who we are because we do not know whose we are
we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him
give us the power to overpass the ultimate terrors
we seem unable to diagnose the cause

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon posits that the crisis is one of 'Knowing' (Identity). By knowing 'whose' we are, we receive the 'pouvoir' (power) to face the world.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Terrors) to ~S1 (Secularism/Lostness) to S1 (Identity in Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Object' (The Cross) which functions as a bridge over the chasm of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'ultimate dreads' are treated as insuperable by human effort.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the minister is the rhetorical subject, the 'engine' is theocentric. The human condition is described as a 'lostness' that only God's 'eternally valid act' can solve.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the minister of Jesus Christ comes, a lonely knight

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God, once and for all, has assessed our value to his heart.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Job, New Testament Christians) are used to illustrate a state of being or a promise received, not a moral behavior to emulate.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and restoration of identity; moving from anxiety to peace.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic regarding value and status.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon masterfully links global politics, psychological malaise, and cosmic sin into a single 'lack' that only the Cross fills.
spanning_punten: The 'Lonely Knight' imagery risks making the minister the savior rather than the messenger.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God has thrown in for us... what God's heart considers to be our worth

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is mentioned as 'spiritual reserves' but not as a distinct actant.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as a 'malady' and 'alienation' that causes mental collapse.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is soundly grace-oriented. The 'Subject' of the sermon is the Minister, but the 'Subject' of the Gospel within the sermon is God.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The opening imagery places the Minister as the 'Lonely Knight' (Subject) facing the dragons.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Position Christ as the Knight/Subject and the Minister as the Herald.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'The minister comes as a lonely knight,' use 'The Minister comes to announce the Knight who has already slain the dragon.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on 'Whose we are'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the Holy Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' to live out this identity.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already takes sin and death with utmost seriousness.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of theocentric preaching that addresses modern psychological needs without lapsing into therapeutic moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Lonely Knight' metaphor; semiotics reveals that despite this metaphor, the 'Object' (Salvation) is entirely God-given.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the context of 1 John; semiotics looks at how 1 John functions as a 'Savoir-faire' competence for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Opponent' is not just the world, but a specific lack of 'Savoir' (Identity) which the 'Sender' (God) restores.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses high literary style but maintains a deep structure of divine agency.
